Description: Round-topped limestone stela; winged sun-disc with pendent crowned uraei at the top above a scene of the deceased woman being led by the hands by Anubis and Horus before Osiris(enthroned), Isis and Nephthys, Apis stands to the right; above the figures are columns of barely visible Hieroglyphic text in red paint; below are seven incised double lines that originally separated more text(now missing); central horizontal crack.
Curator's comments: Translation: Maystre, Les grands pretres de Ptah de Memphis (OBO 113): p.428-430 cf. J. Quaegebeur, Chronique d'Egypte 49 (1974), 66 (no. 12). Published: Albersmeier, Unterschungen zu den Frauenstatuen, 95 n. 550; 98 n. 563; 146 n. 861; 237 n. 361; 271 n. 473.
Acquisition notes: Erroneously indicated in earlier Merlin records as coming from the 1835 Salt sale, but a. it is not in the catalogue b. it appears to be item 50 in the 1821 list of the Salt collection [NCS 9/2/05]
